subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Test coverage - Statement complete
msgSnippet: Hello, I am not unbiased but we have a pretty good tool at: http://testersedge.com/gjtk/ It is free only for non-commercial use, but most users are pleased
messageBody:
Hello,

I am not unbiased but we have a pretty good tool at:

http://testersedge.com/gjtk/

It is free only for non-commercial use, but most users
are pleased with performance and ease of use. It will
even attribute the coverage to specific JUnit tests.

Scott



--- shmaytan <shmaytan@...> wrote:
> Hi!
>
> I have a bunch of white-box Junit tests and I would
> like to check if I
> have executed every line of code with the tests.
> Not just every
> method, but every line of code within the method.
>
> Does anyone know of a good tool (hopefully free...)
> that works on Linux???
>
> Thanks,
> -Eytan
>
>
>
>
>
